Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement from the technology and design sector - "come up here, we'll fix that." The Dutch are deeply offended. The US feels alienated by Dutch indecisiveness and apathetic responses, whereas the Dutch are insulted by the self-righteous velocity and need of the Americans to solve all

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision on this film is the incredibly clichéd ending: attempting to induce tears and laughs by using formulaic character development and wrapping it all up in one big, cheesy romantic finale that I knew was coming from the offset. Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to my point of view is a pretty traditional one, with regards to storytelling in general, in which we start at the very beginning of a fantasy story.
